title: Associate - Debt Finance (Junior Level)
description:
**Vill du vara med och bygga världens ledande affärsjuridiska advokatbyrå?**
**Är du i slutet av din juristutbildning eller har du nyligen tagit juristexamen? White & Case söker associates till Debt Finance med start i slutet av januari 2026.**
**Om oss**
 White & Case är en av världens största och främsta advokatbyråer. Sedan starten i New York 1901 har vi expanderat internationellt och etablerat 44 kontor i 30 länder. Många av våra klienter är multinationella organisationer med komplexa behov som kräver engagemang från flera av våra kontor samtidigt. Det betyder att vi arbetar i en dynamisk miljö med kollegor från hela världen och har gedigen erfarenhet av internationell affärsjuridik. Våra specialistområden på Stockholmskontoret inkluderar M&A/Corporate, M&A/Private Equity, Capital Markets, Debt Finance och Disputes.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
 Vi söker dig som snart ska ta, eller nyligen har tagit, din juristexamen och har ett genuint intresse för affärsjuridik. För att trivas hos oss tycker du om att arbeta projektbaserat, kommersiellt och i team. Vi tror även att du är en lagspelare och tycker om att utvecklas snabbt. Examen i företagsekonomi, tingstjänstgöring eller tidigare relevant arbetslivserfarenhet kan vara meriterande men är inget krav. Eftersom vi är en internationell byrå behöver du, utöver svenska, även ha goda kunskaper i engelska.
   

  

 Vi letar alltid efter individer som kan bidra med olika perspektiv och erfarenheter för att gemensamt leverera förstklassig service till våra klienter. Vi lovar att du kommer utvecklas snabbt i din roll som associate samtidigt som du kommer ha roligt och skapa både relationer och kontakter för livet.
   

  

**Rollen som associate**
 Som associate i vår Debt Finance-grupp kommer du att vara en viktig del av ett sammansvetsat team med bred erfarenhet inom sitt verksamhetsområde. Vi arbetar i högprofilerade ärenden med en mängd olika klienter, omfattande både svenska och internationella private equity-fonder, företag, banker och finansiella institutioner. Vår rådgivning fokuserar på leveraged finance och omfattar en bred variation av finansieringsarrangemang inom både lån och obligationer, såsom förvärvsfinansieringar, IPO-finansieringar, fondfinansieringar och refinansieringar. Inom Debt Finance kommer du regelbundet att bistå i frågor rörande avtalsrätt, fordringsrätt, sakrätt, bolagsrätt och insolvensrätt, med ett starkt fokus på kommersiell och klientorienterad rådgivning i en internationell miljö.
   

  

**Varför White & Case**
 På vårt Stockholmskontor är vi 130 medarbetare och arbetar efter våra värderingar Pioneering, United och Human. Vi strävar alltid efter att utvecklas och gör det helst tillsammans. Vi är en integrerad del av en av världens största och främsta advokatfirmor och har därmed unika förutsättningar att hantera de största och mest komplexa transaktionerna, processerna och affärsjuridiska frågorna. På White & Case arbetar du i en organisation med täta kontakter med våra andra kontor där det är lika naturligt att prata med och träffa kollegor i London, New York, Paris eller Frankfurt som kollegorna i Stockholm och Helsingfors.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vill du bli en del av vårt team? Ansök med ditt CV (på engelska), personligt brev (på engelska) samt betyg från juristprogrammet. Vi rekryterar löpande till tjänsten. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Head of HR, Petra Lindeblad petra.lindeblad@whitecase.com, Talent Acquisition & HR Advisor, Cajsa Billebjer cajsa.billebjer@whitecase.com eller Partner Oscar Liljeson, oscar.liljeson@whitecase.com
   

  

**Placering och rapportering**
 Placeringsort: Biblioteksgatan 12, Stockholm
   

  

 Rapporterar till: Ansvarig partner på Debt Finance, Stockholm
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 White & Case is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and is committed to creating a fair workplace. It is our Firm’s policy to recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other category protected by applicable law.
   

  

 The Firm may modify and amend this job description at any time at its sole discretion. Nothing herein creates a contract of employment or otherwise modifies the at-will nature of employment.

title: Junior Legal Counsel
description:
**About**
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* 
***Junior Legal Counsel***
*to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*
***Period:***
*2025-08-11 to 2026-04-10 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*
**About The Role**
 We are seeking an outstanding junior Legal counsel to join our client's Legal Licensing and Business Development team on a temporary basis in Stockholm.
   

  

 As Legal counsel, you will partner with, and provide legal mentorship to, our client's Business Development teams with a particular focus on enabling the distribution of the client via a wide range of partnerships. Our deals are often cutting edge, revolutionary and always evolving so it will be up to you to continuously assess and advise the teams on legal issues, and unlock partnerships, using a creative, solution orientated and pragmatic approach.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Review, draft, negotiate and manage a wide range of commercial agreements, including reseller and distribution agreements
* Collaborate with their accounting, finance and licensing teams on the drafting and implementation of agreements enabling partners to distribute Premium offerings
* Improve standard form agreements and legal processes to help our client scale globally with a consistent but locally relevant approach
* Work closely with the business teams to summarize and communicate legal concepts clearly and effectively and help them synthesize legal frameworks into their business/deal strategies
* Advise the business on relevant legal contexts, issues and risks, complex agreement structures, approval processes, and company policies and procedures


**Who You Are**
* Law Degree (or equivalent) from top-tier university
* ~2-3 years of post-qualification experience working in a top tier law firm and/or in-house legal department
* Team player with an ability to work autonomously
* Previous experience partnering with global stakeholders and partners
* Strong track record of working with a wide range of commercial agreements (any focus on technology, business development, content licensing, media and IP deal a bonus)
* You have excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively
* You are inquisitive and challenge the effectiveness of current processes and procedures, constantly seeking ways to improve


**We are Market Partner**
*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.*

title: Legal Counsel (junior profile)
description:
**About**
 Lysa’s vision is to set a new standard in savings through automation, efficiency and an unwavering dedication to our customers' best interests. We believe that many institutions work against their customers and we see a significant opportunity to establish a new financial champion.
   

  

 We are on a mission to make it simpler for people to save smarter. To achieve this, we need to continuously develop our product and expand into new markets. We have an outstanding team, but to further accelerate growth, we need more talented colleagues. We are now looking for a Legal Counsel with approx. 1 years’ experience to join our growing legal team.
   

  

****The opportunity****
 This is a unique opportunity to become part of a highly skilled and collaborative team, working across all legal entities in the Lysa Group – the securities company, the fund company, and the insurance company. As a legal team member, you will work closely with all our in-house lawyers (currently five people, soon to be seven) where the need is greatest, which means broad exposure to different legal areas and business initiatives from day one.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone early in their career – perhaps with experience from a law firm, court service or regulated industry – who wants to grow fast in a dynamic and supportive environment. You’ll gain valuable insight into how legal as an integral part contributes to product development and business success, while also having the opportunity to specialize over time based on your interests and the company’s evolving needs.
   

  

****Key responsibilities****
* Legal assessments related to new products, regulatory developments, and business initiatives.
* Legal research, documentation and internal advisory work.
* Reviewing and preparing customer agreements and information, internal policies, and governance documents.
* Assisting in regulatory frameworks such as Solvency II, MiFID II, IDD, AIFMD and UCITS.
* Collaborating with our customer support team on legal questions raised by customers.
* Matters related to corporate and employment law.


****What we are looking for****
 We believe you share our values at Lysa and that you are eager to join us on our journey to become European champions in savings, investments and pensions. You thrive in a fast pace digital environment where everything is evolving.
   

  

 You are structured, service-minded and eager to learn. You are also motivated by being close to the business and making a difference – and excited to work with legal topics that matter for customers, product, and compliance.
   

  

**Qualifications** 
  

  

* A Swedish LL.M. degree with strong academic results.
* Approx. 1 years' qualified legal experience, e.g. from:
+ A district court (tingsmeritering)
+ A law firm
+ A company in the financial industry or public authority

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, structured and effective in execution.
* Thrive in a high-influence, high-responsibility environment.
* Solution oriented.
* Unpretentious, ambitious, and responsible team player.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both Swedish and English, capable of explaining complex legal issues simply.


****Bonus points for:****
* Work experience during studies – especially in legal roles or in the financial sector.
* Any prior exposure to the regulated/financial industry.
* Genuine interest in personal finance and savings.


****What we offer****
 At Lysa, you’ll be part of a high-performing legal team embedded in one of the most exciting companies in the Nordic fintech scene. We value collaboration, learning, and shared responsibility. You’ll gain hands-on experience across multiple areas of law, get close to product and business teams, and have real influence from the very start.
   

  

 Lysa is one of Sweden’s fastest growing FinTech companies - and the largest provider of digital discretionary portfolio management in the Nordics. Lysa is the only new player within our field to have truly succeeded in establishing itself in the Nordics over the past 20 years – something we are both proud of and humbled by. Today 170 000 of all adult Swedes are paying customers and we manage more than 4 bnEUR. We have launched our platform in Denmark and Finland, and also in Germany. Our team of 75 has a mission-driven culture, a high employee Net Promoter Score (eNPS), and a strong commitment to making a significant impact on the European savings market
   

  

****Department & location****
 This role is part of our Legal team, based in Stockholm or Karlskrona, reporting to the General Counsel.
   

  

**Application**
 If you're a highly motivated lawyer, we want to hear from you.The recruitment process is being managed by our partners at Recommended by. For inquiries, you are welcome to contact our recruitment specialist, Emma Bernström, at .
   

  

 #J-18808-Ljbffr
   

  

* Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden


 Work experience

title: Strategic Account Advisor, Stockholm, Sweden
description:
**About**
 This is a unique opportunity to join a team of ex- Top Tier Strategy Consultants, working as a SWAT team for the Northern Europe CEO. Salesforce is looking for very hardworking and passionate individuals to be based in Sweden who can effectively articulate how & why our solutions can help transform Customers’ business and exceed their goals!
   

  

 Salesforce is aspiring to deliver business transformation enabled by technology to its customers and therefore requires individuals able to develop deep insight into the business dynamics of large, sophisticated enterprises and help shape customers change agenda.
   

  

 This role is an exciting blend of frontline commercial execution and long-term strategic thinking.
   

  

 You will work with our Enterprise sales teams on the biggest and most important sales opportunities in across the Nordics and Benelux, engaging with C-level customers and providing structure, insight, and leadership to help sales teams drive opportunities over the finish line. Specifically, this role is passionate about definition of Account Strategies, delivery of C-Level value propositions, investment justifications and development of sophisticated deal structures and commercial proposals for large deals.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work with Enterprise sales teams to define the commercial strategy; prioritise sales initiatives based on problems, value creation potential, and customers’ strategic priorities
* Build and deliver compelling Investment Justifications to secure Customers’ funding for Salesforce solutions. Work closely with account teams and customers to identify, analyse key business value drivers
* Articulate how our solutions will digitally transform customers’ businesses at scale
* Put together attractive deal structures and articulate the value of our Proposals
* Create and deliver C- level compelling propositions as basis for strategic technology decisions


**Experience & Skills**
* Required experience in a Top -Tier Strategy Consulting Firm
* Role seniority determined by experience levels
* Strong analytical & problem solving skills essential
* Strong ability to create, quantify insights and communicate recommendations to CxOs
* Strong influencing capabilities; must be a self-starter, high energy
* Strong inclination to Technology & Enterprise Software industry
* Strong appetite to work in a consultative strategic selling environment.
* MBA degree
* For this role, it is essential that candidates are proficient in Swedish .

description:

****We’re Hiring:****
 Country Controller

 Stockholm, Sweden

*****At OX2, your work will make a lasting impact. We*****
*****are committed to accelerating access to renewable energy, thereby powering the great shift toward a sustainable future.*****
*****Join OX2 and be part of a team driving meaningful progress while advancing your career.** 
 Let’s power the great shift together.***
****Country Controller Sweden****
 As
 **Country Controller** 
 , you will be responsible for all controlling activities across the full project lifecycle — from acquisition, development, realization and construction to operations focusing on Italy. You will lead cost controlling across the country’s cost centers and ensure financial transparency, accuracy, and alignment with our strategic goals. You’ll report directly to our
 **Group Business Control** 
 function.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Own the financial management, monthly closing and management reporting for the Italian market.
* Conduct in-depth P&L and balance sheet analysis on a monthly basis, identifying and explaining deviations vs. budget and forecast.
* Provide insights into asset performance, development costs, personnel and external costs.
* Lead project controlling , coordinating monthly reports and liaising with Project Managers, Investment Director, and Country Manager.
* Maintain project budgets and deliver analysis of financial performance (P&L and cash flow).
* Oversee construction controlling , ensuring governance according to milestone frameworks.
* Drive forecasting and annual budgeting in collaboration with Group Business Control.
* Monitor and track key business drivers (KPIs) , offering actionable insights to leadership.
* Support in transaction processes and the evolution of financial IT systems.
* Actively contribute to the improvement of controlling tools and methodologies across countries through collaboration with peers.


****Skills and Qualifications****
* Proven experience in controlling, FP&A or financial management – preferably in a project-driven or energy/infrastructure business environment.
* Strong analytical mindset and hands-on experience with project and cost controlling .
* Excellent communication skills in both Italian and English is a must.
* Solid understanding of IFRS and local GAAP requirements.
* Proficiency in financial systems and tools (ERP, BI tools, Excel etc.).
* Experience with IFS is considered valuable but not a must.


****What we can offer you****
**Role**
 If you are not already convinced that this is the role for you, here are some more bullets as to why you should join our mission to accelerate access to renewable energy:
   

  

* A truly international company withcollaboration across functions and geographies.
* A knowledgeable team of experts and an energetic, fun workplace located at Lilla Nygatan 1, Stockholm.
* A market based compensation and benefits package.


****The Recruitment Process****
 We reviewapplications ongoing, so do not hesitate to send in your application as soon as possible, however
 **please note that due to summer and annual leave, the selection process and interviews will be conducted in August.**
**About OX2**
 OX2 develops, constructs, sells, owns, and operates renewable energy solutions at scale. OX2’s project development portfolio consists of in-house developed as well as acquired projects in onshore and offshore wind, solar, and energy storage, in various phases of development. OX2 operates across Europe and in Australia. The company has about 500 employees and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. OX2 is owned by EQT, one of the world’s largest private equity investors.

title: Data Scientist - Expertstöd Grafer, Stockholm
description:
**About**
 \*\*Om konsultuppdraget\*\*
   

  

* Ort: Stockholm
* Uppdragslängd: Ca. 12+ månader
* Uppdragsstart: Enligt ök.
* \_Sista ansökningsdagen: ansök snarast\_
* Omfattning: 100%
* Arbetsbeskrivning\*\*:


 Designa, implementera och vidareutveckla applikationer för flaskhalshantering och budfiltrering samt prognoser. Utveckla och driftsätta nya modeller samt följa arbeta med livscykelhanteringen av ML-modeller.
   

  

 Plattformar och tekniker/språk som används i projektet är Python, Docker/Kubernetes/Open Shift. Versionshantering av kod och CI/CD-processen hanteras i Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra projektteam bestående av Data Scientists, Data Engineers, integrationsutvecklare samt DevOps-resurser.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att sökande är driven med en förmåga att själv hitta förslag till förbättringar och nya lösningar. Du ska ha mycket god kommunikations
   

  

* och samarbetsförmåga. Du har lätt för att skapa nya relationer då denna roll innebär många kontaktytor inom organisationen, men även med våra grannländers mot-svarande roller.
* Obligatoriska kompetenser och erfarenhet (skallkrav)\*\*:
* Utbildning (Kunden kan på begäran kräva in bevis för utbildning eller certifikat)\*\*:
* Konsulten ska ha en master inom matematik, fysik eller statistik alternativt civilingenjör mot datavetenskap, elektroteknik/elkraftteknik, teknisk fysik eller motsvarande kompetens.
* Kompetens och Erfarenhet\*\*:
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som data scientist och programmering i språket Python.
* Praktisk arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med Machine Learning från minst 2 projekt.
* Utvecklat beslutsstöd med hjälp av tekniken grafdatabaser i minst 1 projekt.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete i Linux.
* Tala och skriva Svenska och Engelska obehindrat.
* Meriterande kompetenser och erfarenhet (börkrav)\*\*:
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla beslutsstöd för kontrollrumsmiljö eller kraftsystemsimulatorer i minst 1 projekt.
* Arbetat som data scientist hos TSO/DSO alternativt hos en balansansvarig/elhandlare i minst 1 projekt.
* Högre utbildningsnivå så som doktorsexamen
* Önskemål om personliga egenskaper\*\*:
* God samarbetsförmåga och initiativförmåga
* Flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning
* Utåtriktad och tydlig i sin kommunikation
* Ödmjuk och ha lätt för att skapa förtroende
* Arbetar självständigt och målinriktat
* Fallenhet för administrativa arbetsuppgifter
* Förmåga att arbeta i grupp


 \*\*Hur du kommer vidare\*\*
   

  

* Sök uppdraget genom denna annons
* I ansökan anger du ett kravställt timpris
* Lägg in ett CV på svenska i word-format
* Vi återkopplar om något behöver kompletteras eller förtydligas.
* Återkoppling sker vanligtvis från Kunden till oss inom 10 arbetsdagar från det att ansökningstiden utgått. Vi försöker återkoppla omgående till dig som kandidat snarast vi har ny information avseende din ansökan eller uppdraget. Skulle återkoppling dröja, vänligen kontakta oss genom att svara på det bekräftande mailutskicket i samband med din ansökan.


 På uppmaning från beställare/slutkunder vill de inte att vi lämnar ut information om dem. En annan anledning är att Shaya Solutions lägger stor mängd tid som man på förhand inte får betalt för såvida inte uppdraget tillsätts, och därav kan vara återhållsamma med informationsdelningen av naturliga skäl.
   

  

 Inför en eventuell intervju meddelas du om vilken Kunden är i god tid.
   

  

 \*\*Om Shaya Solutions\*\*
   

  

 Konsult
   

  

* och kompetenspartner inom IT, Management och Ingenjörstjänster.


 Vi lägger ett stort fokus på kund-/konsultpartnernöjdhet och kvalité i våra leveranser och verkar idag på 13 orter i Sverige med utgångspunkt i Stockholm.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen att höra av dig vid frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Annonsförsäljare undanbedes.
   

  

 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Docker
* Kubernetes
* Linux
* Python

 Work experience

* Machine Learning
* IT Consultant

title: Head of Contracting Nordics
description:
**About**
**What you will do on your journey with WebBeds.**
 As the Head of Contracting for the Nordics, you will lead and inspire a regional team to drive hotel supply growth, strengthen commercial partnerships, and maximize portfolio performance. Reporting to the Vice President of Contracting for Northern Europe, you’ll take full ownership of sourcing strategy across Sweden, Denmark, and neighbouring markets. This is a hands-on leadership role blending strategic oversight, supplier engagement, and direct contracting responsibilities. You will cultivate high-performing teams, develop key hotel relationships, and ensure consistent delivery against revenue and margin goals.
   

  

**In This Role You Will**
 Lead the Nordics contracting team, ensuring performance goals are met while coaching team members and promoting best practices. You’ll manage your own hotel portfolio, negotiating competitive contracts, securing promotional opportunities, and enhancing portfolio coverage. By building strong commercial relationships with hotel partners and internal stakeholders, you’ll drive strategic outcomes and long-term value. You’ll also oversee recruitment, talent development, and process improvement across the team, helping to grow WebBeds’ footprint in the Nordic region.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities.**
* Lead and manage the regional team to ensure all members meet their KPIs and objectives. Support performance through regular monitoring, open feedback, and by fostering a culture of innovation and proactivity.
* Conduct regular one-to-one meetings with the team member & the Vice President of Northern Europe to maintain strong two-way communication
* Support recruitment activities within the department as required.
* Set high standards and enhance the team’s commercial capability. Identify development needs and support individual growth through coaching, mentoring, and training. Accompany team members on business trips where appropriate to provide in-the-field support.
* Ensure the team is fully familiar with key procurement tools and requirements relevant to the region, including connectivity and channel manager usage.
* Empower the team to manage and strengthen commercial relationships with hotel partners, including key regional chains, working closely with internal stakeholders such as Reservations, Sales, Revenue, and Accounts.
* Promote strong internal communication by sharing successful contracting initiatives and flagging any destination-related issues with relevant departments in a timely manner.
* Deliver against annual departmental and individual KPIs and objectives.
* Negotiate and secure competitive contracts that meet company requirements for rates, allocations, overrides, and other key commercial terms within your assigned area.
* Regularly analyse production data to ensure sufficient inventory aligned with destination performance targets.
* Optimise contract performance by securing tactical promotions and special offers to drive competitiveness and sales.
* Ensure timely re-contracting of existing hotels in line with agreed renewal cycles and business timelines.
* Identify and prioritise contracting of ‘must-have’ hotels to enhance regional portfolio strength.
* Lead strategic negotiations and partnership management with key hotel chains to maximise market share and long-term collaboration.
* Plan and carry out in-year contracting trips to secure renewals and sign new properties, aligned with personal and team targets.
* Negotiate added-value offers and exclusive deals to support revenue growth and distribution advantage.
* Monitor competitor pricing and availability, responding to market demand and trends proactively.
* Proactively address supplier-related service level issues, ensuring high standards of delivery.
* Conduct regular hotel inspections and ensure up-to-date, accurate product content (e.g., amenities, photos, facilities).
* Share relevant destination intelligence internally, including peak travel dates, local events, and trade shows.
* Take responsibility for mitigating commercial losses through proactive negotiation and issue resolution.
* Identify underperforming hotels and implement actions to improve or replace them as appropriate.


**The skills we would love to see in your suitcase.**
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in hotel contracting and team management.
* Proven track record in hotel partnerships and commercial performance within the Nordics market.
* Demonstrated experience in managing relationships with major hotel chains in the region.
* Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills.
* Proactive leadership style with the ability to develop and motivate teams.
* High attention to detail and accuracy.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English; fluency in one or more Nordic languages is an advantage.
* Comfortable working under pressure and focused on achieving results.
* Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
* Confident team leadership and delegation.
* Strong internal and external communication.
* Willingness to travel within the region.


 WebBeds is a global digital travel marketplace for the travel trade, an intermediary connecting hotels and other travel service suppliers to a distribution network of travel buyers all over the world. We connect hotels looking to fill rooms with buyers trying to find rooms. In short, we source bookable content, integrate, aggregate and merchandise that content in our platform, then distribute it to a global network of travel trade buyers, who sell to the travelling public.
   

  

 Our Products range from a Retail Online platform, Integration Connectivity hub and distribution APIs to name but a few and our systems are 100% cloud hosted processing up to 8.3bn search requests daily, with 17million rooms nights sold in FY24. We deliver amazing outcomes using leading edge technology through innovative and creative thinking; and products help our partners deliver amazing travel experiences, enabling travel the world over.
   

  

**Some things that make us stand out!**
* We are a truly global travel organisation, with a global footprint.
* We have 1200+ people speaking 50+ languages in 120+ cites across 50+ countries.
* We partner with over 500,000 properties in more than 39,000 locations.
* We work with more than 50,000 travel buyers in 140 source markets.
* We have an amazing team delivering valuable outcomes using innovative tech and creative, lateral thinking.


****Working at WebBeds****
 WebBeds is a fast-paced, results-driven business and that is reflected throughout our company, in our technology, product and perhaps most importantly – in our people. Visit ‘Careers’ for jobs around the world of WebBeds.
   

  

 Global and regional hotel chains, independent hotels, apartments, resorts, attractions, transfer and sightseeing companies and more – can sell their products through WebBeds by connecting to a global network of over 50,000 online and offline travel buyers through robust solutions that provide greater inventory control to simplify distribution, and leverage WebBeds enhanced analytics to inform inventory optimisation choices – saving costs and increasing revenue.
   

  

 Online travel agencies, retail travel agents, corporate travel managers, tour operators, wholesalers, tourism boards, super apps, DMC’s, group providers, airlines and more – can integrate the hundreds of thousands of hotels and ground services in the WebBeds marketplace through simple and seamless API connectivity, or they can search, shop and book online through one of WebBeds trade only booking sites.
   

  

**Our operation.**
 We operate globally through four geographic regions – Europe, Asia Pacific, MEA (Middle East and Africa) and the Americas – with over 2,000 travel professionals working in 120 cities across 50 countries worldwide. WebBeds also operates specialist brands JacTravel DMC and UHl. JacTravel DMC provides tailormade travel arrangements for offline FIT and groups traveling to the UK, Ireland and key mainland European destinations to the international travel trade. UHI is a genuine pioneer, providing online pilgrimage travel services to travel agencies worldwide.
   

  

 WebBeds is a travel brand of the Web Travel Group, an ASX 200 listed company (ASX: WEB) operating global digital travel businesses.

title: Data & Launch Coordinator Vitamin Well Group
description:
At
 **Vitamin Well Group,** 
 we provide great-tasting drinks, snacks, and protein products. Our brands Vitamin Well, NOCCO, and Barebells are available across most of Europe, North America, the MENA region, and parts of Asia Pacific. With a revenue of 650 million euros, we operate in over 40 markets, with headquarters in Stockholm and offices in fourteen countries around the world.
   

  

 With a strong focus on data accuracy and a growing global presence, Vitamin Well Group is now looking for a
 **Data & Launch Coordinator** 
 to join the HQ team in Stockholm. In this role, you’ll work closely with our Master Data Specialist and Launch Coordinator to support and improve the quality of our product data across 40+ markets.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our new Data & Launch Coordinator, you will play a key part in developing and improving our data and launch processes. The role involves close collaboration with departments across the organization – including Operations, Product Development, Supply Chain, Sales and IT – to ensure data accuracy and efficient product information workflows.
   

  

 You will support daily operations, handle various administrative tasks, and contribute to our continued growth. The role reports to the Head of Operations, International Markets, and is based at our office in Stockholm.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

* Process development: Support the development and maintenance of efficient processes in our Product Information Management (PIM) system and PLM tool (Monday), ensuring smooth operations.
* Data quality assurance: Ensure the correct administration and quality assurance of product data in our ERP (Dynamics 365), PLM (Monday) and PIM system, across all categories and markets.
* Product information coordination: Distribute and manage product data to customers and stakeholders, locally and globally, with accuracy and timeliness.
* System administration: Support end-users by providing guidance and training in our systems (ERP, PIM, PLM), and contribute to increased efficiency and user proficiency.
* Launch support: Assist in the coordination of product launches across new and existing markets, ensuring alignment with timelines and requirements.
* Administrative support: Perform various administrative tasks, including documentation and communication, to support the team’s daily operations and overall efficiency.


 Who are you
   

  

 You have some prior experience in a similar role or a degree in a relevant field - and feel comfortable working in ERP systems like Microsoft Dynamics 365. You approach your work with a structured and solution-oriented mindset, and you’re confident navigating both independent tasks and collaborative projects.
   

  

 With a sharp eye for detail, you take pride in maintaining accurate product data and managing administrative tasks with precision. You enjoy working with systems, are quick to learn new tools, and take ownership of your responsibilities. You’re comfortable in cross-functional settings and contribute to a high standard of operational support. With a proactive attitude and genuine motivation, you contribute to daily operations and continuously look for ways to improve processes and efficiency.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, we believe that you bring:
   

  

* Technical skills - Familiarity with ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365, strong skills in Excel. Experience with PIM systems (e.g., Inriver) and PLM tools (e.g., Monday) is a plus.
* Attention to detail - Accuracy in product data and confidence in handling administrative tasks.
* Language proficiency - Fluent in both Swedish and English, with excellent communication skills.
* Collaboration - A team player who communicates well across departments.
* Drive and motivation - Proactive and committed to supporting daily operations and continuous improvement.


 Welcome with your application at the latest August 15th 2025.
   

  

*We will review applications on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the last application day. Please note that the process may take longer than usual due to the summer holiday period. We appreciate LinkedIn, but to get a full picture of your experience, we ask you to also include a CV.*
**Life at Vitamin Well Group**
 Our growing family is made up of over 600 employees, representing a variety of cultures, experiences and diverse backgrounds. This diversity is a great asset as we continue our expansion and evolve our portfolio. At the same time, Vitamin Well is still very much a Swedish company, promoting Swedish values when it comes to both business and people. We treat each other in a fair and equal way, and we respect one another based on our qualities. As we expand Vitamin Well Group’s business, we are also committed to minimizing our environmental impact and continuously strive to lower emissions from for example production, logistics, and packaging.
   

  

 Working at Vitamin Well, we provide a dynamic environment defined by ambition, dedication, and an entrepreneurial spirit. In our action-oriented culture, the ability to make swift decisions is paramount in bringing ideas to fruition. We are committed to fostering an atmosphere where every individual's unique strengths contribute to our collective success. As a health and exercise-oriented company, we inspire an active lifestyle by partnering with top-performing athletes, but we also promote and support exercise among our employees.
   

  

*As part of the recruitment process, we may ask you to conduct a personality test as well as a test that measures logical ability. The purpose of the tests is to evaluate candidates as objective as possible and identify the best possible match for the role. The tests are based on solid research and are taken through our partner Alva Labs.*

title: Brand Marketing Director (14-Month Fixed Term)
description:
**About**
**About us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth , where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for aDirector of Brand Marketing & Creative for a 14-month temporary position to cover for a parental leave. You will beresponsible for driving our brand positioning, and how it’s tied to our marketing creative execution.
   

  

 You’ll be developing and implementing Soundtrack’s brand in marketing efforts, working with and managing an internal team with design, content and development plus external agencies for creative assets.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with our Director of Digital Marketing and together lead our, growing and impactful, marketing department at Soundtrack.
 **Responsibilities**
* Continue refining and defining our brand marketing strategy.
* Plan and prioritize work for creative teams.
* Work closely with agencies, ensuring good collaboration and joint processes.
* Work with analysts and user researchers to find the insights and success recipes for our execution.
* Serve as a stakeholder for our product teams in terms of connecting our marketing initiatives to website, content and user onboarding.
* Manage and develop our next brand awareness concept.
* Establish and maintain our way of working and culture.
* Consult and work with our PR agency in getting publicity for the company.


**About You**
 Just like us, you love music. You're driven and entrepreneurial, but you know how to be a team player too. Regardless of roles, we're always looking to work with people who can adapt to constant change, prioritise what's important, stay humble, open, curious and with a passion for details.
   

  

 Soundtrack is a Product Led Growth (PLG) company where the product naturally extends as a central piece in our marketing. You’re therefore either a marketing leader with experience from product companies, or a product leader with marketing experience. You have the ability to combine a vision, purpose and data with “a creative eye”.
   

  

**Requirements**
* At least 8 years of experience working in marketing and/or product roles.
* Experience with leading and managing teams, preferably both directly and indirectly.
* Strong experience in project management and managing multiple stakeholders.
* Ability to digest, translate and communicate data and insights into actionable plans.
* Comfortable working and making decisions based on data and experimentation.


**Location:** 
 Stockholm. We require the person in this role to be on-site three days a week due to the coordination-heavy nature of the work.
   

  

 We will be taking a short summer break and will be back in
 **mid-August** 
 . You're welcome (and encouraged!) to
 **apply now** 
 , and we’ll review all applications as soon as we return.
   

  

 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate before the application deadline. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Sebastian Palmqvist at .Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Sommarjobb Som Vaktmästare
description:
**About**
 \*\*Nu söker vi dig som är intresserad av att arbeta som kontorsvaktmästare under sommaren! Tjänsten tillsätts omgående - vänta inte med din ansökan.\*\*
   

  

 \*\*Om uppdraget\*\*
   

  

 Vår kund i centrala Stockholm söker en vaktmästare till ett uppdrag över sommaren, med start snarast. Uppdraget är på heltid och löper fram till 31 augusti.
   

  

 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag med anställning hos Bemannia.
   

  

 \*\*Dina arbetsuppgifter\*\*
   

  

 Som lokaladministratör arbetar du i en varierande roll med underhåll och skötsel av kundens lokaler och kontorsutrustning inklusive godsmottagning samt service och support. Du arbetar på vaktmästeriet tillsammans med en kollega.
   

  

 I arbetet ingår administration gällande det som är förenat med kundens lokal som består av bokningssystem, kaffe & vatten, frukt & mjölk, larm & skalskydd, mobiltelefoni & fast telefonabonnemang, återvinning, entrémattor mm. Du ingår i enheten internservice och rapporterar till internservicechef.
   

  

 \*\*Dina kvalifikationer\*\*
   

  

 Du har gymnasieutbildning och vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av liknande tjänst med support och service inom området samt goda IT-kunskaper.
   

  

 \*\*Vad vi erbjuder dig\*\*
   

  

 Som konsult på Bemannia erbjuder vi dig en nära kontakt med din konsultchef och en möjlighet till fler uppdrag via oss. Hos oss får du utvecklas på lärorika arbetsplatser och känna att din kompetens kommer till nytta.
   

  

 \*\*Om ansökan\*\*
   

  

 Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på ansök nedan. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 För generella funderingar kring din ansökan eller vår rekryteringsprocess når du oss under kontorstid på 070 889 2300.
   

  

 Bemannia är ett publikt och svenskägt bemannings
   

  

* och rekryteringsföretag som tillhandahåller kompetent och kvalificerad personal genom uthyrning, rekrytering och personalentreprenader inom Organisation & Ledarskap, PR & Information, Marknad & Sälj, Ekonomi, Juridik, HR & Personal, Fastighet & Teknik, IT & Data samt Kontor & Administration. Bemannia har ramavtal med merparten av Sveriges Myndigheter och Sveriges kommuner, dess förvaltningar och bolag. Bemannia är medlem i Kompetensföretagen och är ett auktoriserat Bemanningsföretag och Rekryteringsföretag samt har kollektivavtal med Unionen, Akademikerna, SEKO samt LO och Hotell
* och Restauranganställdas förbund. Bemannia är certifierat enligt SS-EN ISO 9001:2015, Ledningssystem för kvalitet, SS-EN ISO 14001:2015, Miljöledningssystem - krav och vägledning, SS-ISO 45001:2018, Ledningssystem för arbetsmiljö och SS-ISO/IEC 27001:2013 Ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet


 Ledningen för bolaget har varit verksam i branschen i 40 år.

title: Experience Marketing Director - Product Line Wellbeing & Small Domestic Appliances
description:
**About**
**Experience Marketing Director - Product Line Wellbeing & Small Domestic Appliances**
 Join to apply for the
 **Experience Marketing Director - Product Line Wellbeing & Small Domestic Appliances** 
 role at
 **Electrolux Group**
**Experience Marketing Director - Product Line Wellbeing & Small Domestic Appliances**
 Join to apply for the
 **Experience Marketing Director - Product Line Wellbeing & Small Domestic Appliances** 
 role at
 **Electrolux Group**
 Location: Europe or Bangkok.
   

  

 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people, and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together .Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a visionary leader to drive marketing initiatives within the Wellbeing & Small Domestic Appliances (WB & SDA) category for our Business Area Europe & APMEA.
   

  

 As Experience Marketing Director you will lead the development and execution of campaigns and product launches, driving product awareness and enhancing consumer experiences. Your role will focus on driving marketing strategies, ensuring consistent messaging, and contributing to market leadership. You will oversee a high-performing team, foster cross-functional collaboration, and directly influence the commercial success of the category in the markets. In your role as Experience Marketing Director, you drive consumer experience excellence by prioritizing and managing the CX roadmap across all consumer touchpoints, collaborating with many different stakeholders over several functions.
   

  

 In your role you leverage data analytics and digital tools to optimize marketing strategies, ensuring alignment with consumer trends and behaviors. As Experience Marketing Director It´s of essence to be a strong member of the Marketing Leadership team and influence the marketing mandate for the overall business. In your position you lead change management within the marketing organization, ensuring seamless adoption of new tools, strategies, and processes to stay ahead of industry trends.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the strategic planning and execution of marketing campaigns for WB & SDA, ensuring alignment with brand strategy and commercial objectives.
* Harmonize product launches in collaboration with Global Marketing, Innovation, R&D, Commercial, Design and Market Activation teams, ensuring timely and impactful go-to-market strategies.
* Collaborate closely with senior leadership, product teams, and external partners to align marketing efforts with broader corporate strategies and business goals.
* Drive initiatives that enhance Electrolux’s market leadership by increasing brand/product visibility, consumer engagement, and market share for WB & SDA.
* Own and manage the marketing budget, ensuring optimized spend to maximize return on investment (ROI) and achieve commercial outcomes.
* Lead and drive a strong marketing agenda in the WB Leadership team to support business performance.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, creativity, and performance within a marketing team, developing talent and driving high engagement.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 10 of experience in marketing/ product management roles.
* Proven track record of driving successful product launches and integrated marketing campaigns.
* Strong understanding of consumer behaviour, digital marketing, and CX management.
* Experience in aligning product marketing strategies with sustainability goals and embedding eco-friendly practices into product narratives.
* Exceptional leadership skills with experience managing and developing cross-functional teams.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate insights into actionable strategies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to work across regions and markets.
* Experience managing marketing budgets and optimizing spend to achieve commercial outcomes.
* Ability to lead through change, driving adoption of new strategies, tools, and processes.
* Innovative mindset with a passion for driving growth and challenging the status quo.

* Seniority level Not Applicable

title: Head of Accounting
description:
**About**
**Are you our new Head of Accounting?**
 At Intrum, you will grow by making a difference. You will do it in a highly international environment and in a supportive culture where effort counts. We are now looking for a Head of Accounting to lead the Head Office accounting and play a pivotal role in the accuracy, compliance, and development of financial reporting for our Swedish holding entities, including the parent company of the group.
   

  

**What will you do, as Head of Accounting, you will:**
* Lead the month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close processes for several Swedish entities, including the listed parent company.
* Be accountable for timely and accurate financial reporting in accordance with IFRS and Swedish GAAP, ensuring compliance across all group entities.
* Oversee the preparation of the annual report for the parent company and the statutory accounts of four additional Swedish legal entities.
* Lead and support the team of one direct report and the CoE on daily accounting matters.
* Act as the main liaison with the Group Consolidation, Tax, and Center of Excellence (CoE) teams on accounting matters and cross-functional projects.
* Lead and support audits for Head Office entities, ensuring strong internal controls and audit readiness.
* Approve and oversee supplier invoice controls to ensure accurate cost allocations and VAT compliance.
* Supervise and approve tax and statutory filings, including VAT, social costs, and corporate income tax reporting in collaboration with the Tax department.
* Take a key role in finance transformation projects, including system implementations and process harmonization.
* Develop, document, and improve accounting processes, policies, and controls.
* Coach and mentor your team of one accountant, supporting their development and performance.
* Be a finance business partner with HR, IT and Group Consolidation, contributing to decision-making with solid accounting insights.


**Who You Are**
* A qualified accountant with solid experience from a multinational group, preferably listed.
* Strong knowledge of IFRS and Swedish GAAP, with hands-on experience in statutory reporting and consolidation interfaces.
* You are well-organized, detail-oriented, and used to managing tight deadlines.
* Proven track record of leading accounting teams and closing processes in a complex environment.
* A natural leader who thrives in a structured yet agile setting and is proactive in identifying improvements.
* Strong communicator who can build relationships with senior stakeholders across functions and countries.
* Experienced in working with auditors, tax authorities, and external advisors.
* A strong collaborator who leads by example and inspires trust in colleagues and business partners.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.


**What We Offer**
* A strategic leadership role in Group Finance with visibility across the Intrum Group.
* The opportunity to influence the financial integrity of a publicly listed company.
* An international, forward-thinking environment with skilled and motivated colleagues.
* A company culture where effort counts, and growth and development are encouraged.
* Continuous learning opportunities through our learning arenas and professional networks.


**About Intrum:** 
 Intrum is the industry-leading provider of credit management services across 20 markets in Europe. With around 10,000 professionals serving 80,000 companies, Intrum plays a critical role in the European financial ecosystem. At Intrum, we live our leadership principles: Deliver Impact, Inspire Trust, and Embrace Growth – principles that apply to everyone, regardless of title.
   

  

**How to apply:** 
 If this sounds like your next step, we look forward to receiving your English CV and a cover letter via the “Apply” button. \*\*Please note that as a multinational company, our Global Talent Acquisition Partners is based in Spain. You might receive a call with a Spanish phone number.\*\*
   

  

 At Intrum we strive to create a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

* Finance & Accounting

**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced and forward-thinking
 **Head of Group Risk & Insurance Management** 
 to lead and develop our global risk and insurance strategies. This is a key role within our Group Treasury function, with responsibility for managing the Group's insurance portfolio, coordinating risk management and loss prevention activities, and overseeing our captive insurance company,
 **ASSA ABLOY Försäkrings AB** 
 . The role also plays an active part in the Group Crisis Management Team and provides day-to-day support to our operations around the world.You will join a small, high-performing team that operates globally and provides a unique opportunity to work across a broad spectrum of risk and insurance topics in a complex, decentralized organization.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
**Risk Management** 
 : Lead the continued development of the Group’s risk management framework. Work closely with Group and divisional management to assess overall risk exposure and define appropriate risk mitigation strategies.
   

  

**Insurance Procurement & Strategy** 
 : Manage the placement and ongoing evaluation of global insurance programs, ensuring alignment with the Group’s evolving business strategy and risk appetite.
   

  

**Centre of Excellence** 
 : Act as the Group's internal advisor on insurance and risk-related matters. Provide expert support to business units on claims, contract review, risk modelling, new business concepts, M&A activities, and more.
   

  

**Loss Prevention** 
 : Drive the global loss prevention program in close collaboration with our property insurer and divisional Loss Prevention Managers.
   

  

**Captive Insurance Management** 
 : Serve as Managing Director of the Group’s captive insurance company. This includes operational oversight, managing outsourced partners (e.g., compliance, actuarial, audit), regulatory compliance (including contact with the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority), and the strategic use of the captive to optimize risk retention.
   

  

****Who You Are****
 We are seeking a strategic and hands-on professional with a solid background in insurance and risk management. You combine strong analytical skills with a service-oriented and pragmatic mindset, and you are confident navigating a complex stakeholder landscape.
   

  

 You challenge the status quo and bring a future-focused perspective to risk transfer models and insurance innovation.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
 Several years of experience in insurance and risk management—either from an insurance company, broker, or a similar role in a multinational corporation.
   

  

 Experience advising internal stakeholders in a consultative capacity.
   

  

 Proven expertise in incident and claims management.
   

  

 Previous experience managing a captive insurance company is highly desirable.
   

  

 Familiarity with global loss prevention programs and risk engineering.
   

  

 Strong communication skills, a structured working style, and the ability to influence across cultures and organizational levels.
   

  

 This is an excellent opportunity for a senior insurance and risk professional who wants to operate in a truly global environment, contribute to strategic business resilience, and make a tangible impact across a decentralized, innovation-driven industrial group.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
   

  

**Please note that if you are NOT a passport holder of the country for the vacancy you might need a work permit.** 
 Check our Blog for more information.

title: Dentist - Stockholm
description:
**About**
**Dentist - Stockholm**
 5 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants
   

  

 We are DR.Smile, powered by
 **Impress** 
 . We believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love.
   

  

 We are the largest chain of ortho clinics with fully digital processes. We have revolutionized the invisible orthodontic sector with the best team of professionals specialized in making people smile and using the latest technology for the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of all cases.
   

  

 Born in Barcelona in 2019, we’ve grown to pioneer leading care, flagship clinics and state-of-the-art tech across 8 countries and more than 150 locations, and we are expanding fast! Our aim is to improve people’s health and quality of life across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Dentist who is comfortable working in a fast-paced, digital environment and enjoys interacting with patients. In this role, you will use the latest patented technology in orthodontic care and will be part of a team transforming the future of our industry.
   

  

* Provide general dental care by cleaning teeth, filling cavities, and extractions (where you have experience and autonomy), RAR, and whitening.
* Check teeth, gums, and other parts of the mouth, along with X-rays and tests, to diagnose dental problems.
* Clean teeth and remove plaque.
* Utilize our equipment for gingival recontouring and curettage.
* Conduct root residue extraction and tooth reconstruction.
* Repair and remove problematic or chipped teeth.
* Protect teeth by using sealants or whitening treatments.
* Perform periodontal care by diagnosing and treating gum diseases and infections.
* Explain treatment plans to patients.
* Try to do follow-ups when patients have any urges, such as rebonding an attachment or buttons.
* Assist with quality assurance monitoring and process improvement initiatives.
* In the time without patients, assist the patient care team in preparing the cases for production and answering questions of patients.
* Examine patients’ medical records.
* Prepare patients for treatment (e.g., by applying oral sedation or anesthesia).
* Educate patients on proper brushing techniques, flossing, and fluoride use.
* Promote good oral health and preventive dental care (e.g., by scheduling regular check-ups).
* Prescribe medication as needed.
* Responsibility for the equipment when it is inside the box.
* Availability to travel.
* Deliver WOW experience to every customer.
* Self-motivation and a hunger for success. Never accept results lower than “Impressive”.
* Lead by example and never stop improving.
* Prior experience
* Team player with a willingness to jump in wherever help is needed.
* Must be willing and able to be onsite in the clinic each day.
* Adaptable and flexible - excited to work in an environment that is constantly evolving.
* Collaborative, empathetic, patient, and a positive attitude.
* Swedish licence
* Native Swedish


**Why work with us?**
* Be part of an international and multicultural team!
* A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
* Discounts on our treatments.
* Positive company culture: we celebrate every success!

 We cultivate a culture of inclusion and diversity. We celebrate our employees' individual strengths, views, and experiences and we encourage all candidates to apply, without regard to race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or any other factor.

 **Dentist with experience in Orthodontics** 
 to join our friendly team. An exciting and unique opportunity for you who is passionate about dentistry and is looking for a platform to develop and take their career to the next level!
   

  

 The job role requires
 **experience** 
 in dental scans using a
 **3D Scanner** 
 and providing treatments. Candidates with experience in

 **Full training is given.**
**Dr Smile X Impress** 
 is well-established, and fast-growing company with over
 **150 locations** 
 across 10 countries in Europe.
   

  

**Why Join Us**
* Attractive Compensation Package based on experience and expectations.
* Participate in the medical teams' incentive plan to share in our success.
* Flexible schedule to suit your availability.
* Modern, beautifully designed clinics with high-end equipment.
* Special discounts & benefits on treatments, aligners, and products.
* Comprehensive training for professional growth.
* Dynamic, unique, and fast-paced environment with impressive career development opportunities.

* Be the face of IMPRESS , deliver a world-class experience for every customer.
* Explain, Review and Determine the suitable treatment plans for patients.

We celebrate our employees' individual strengths, views, and experiences and we encourage all candidates to apply, without regard to race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or any other factor.*

title: Programcontroller Till Meko
description:
**About**
 Trivs du i projektmiljö där den ena dagen förmodligen inte är den andra lik? Där du ansvarar för att hålla ihop den ekonomiska uppföljningen av såväl övergripande program som delprojekt? Nu rekryterar vi till en superspännande roll där du får en mix av controlling och projektledning, initialt i en projektorganisation och därefter i en linjeorganisation.
   

  

* Vad kan MEKO erbjuda dig?\*\*


 MEKO är ett börsbolag noterat på MidCap-listan i Stockholm. MEKO är en ledande reservdelsdistributör med välkända koncept och varumärken i norra Europa. Vi har ambitionen att leda utvecklingen i branschen och medverka till transformationen mot en mer miljövänlig bilflotta och finns idag på åtta marknader runt Östersjön.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Programcontroller som får möjlighet att vara med och bygga MEKO:s programorganisation. I rollen som Programcontroller kommer du vara spindeln i nätet och ansvara för den ekonomiska uppföljningen av program och projekt. Du kommer att få arbeta med Business Case, göra kalkyleringar men också vända och vrida på olika lösningar för att tillsammans med verksamhet och Programchef hitta de bästa lösningarna.
   

  

 Hos oss får du en föränderlig miljö, ett nära samarbete med Programchefen och möjlighet att själv leda mindre delprojekt. Rollen rapporterar till Programchef och är placerad på vårt huvudkontor vid Torsplan i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

* Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter\*\*:
* Budget och prognos för projektet
* Business Case inklusive kalkylering av kostnader
* Uppföljning, analys och riskbedömning under programmet
* Finansiellt bollplank till Programchef
* Beräkna vilken finansiell påverkan de beslut har som tas inom projektet
* Uppföljning av investeringar - tidplan, budget och måluppfyllnad.
* Självständigt driva utredningar och mindre delprojekt
* Rapportering till såväl Programchef, Group Finance och Business Areas.
* Identifiera och hantera potentiella risker
* Samarbeta med Programchefen i arbetet med att driva projektet framåt på bästa sätt
* Vem letar vi efter?\*\*


 Vi söker dig med erfarenhet från controlling och med ett stort intresse för IT och som vill vara med på en resa med oss. Eftersom du även kommer att få driva egna utredningar och mindre delprojekt ser vi gärna att du har någon form av erfarenhet som projektledare eller projektdeltagare. Vi söker dig som har relevant akademisk utbildning, exempelvis som ekonom eller ingenjör, samt erfarenhet av att verka inom en större, gärna noterad, koncern. Du kan ha jobbat som Business Controller med erfarenhet av Business Case kopplat till större affärs
   

  

* och IT-investeringar alternativt arbetat som konsult hos Big4 med vana av större projekt.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ser att du har hög analytisk förmåga samt en affärsmässighet. Du har förmågan att ödmjukt våga utmana den kanske givna vägen. Du är kommunikativ och pedagogisk och har förmåga att skapa och bibehålla goda relationer. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du kunna växla mellan strategiska utmaningar och operativa uppgifter och självklart ha förmågan att skapa strukturerad och noggrann uppföljning.
   

  

* Har vi väckt ditt intresse?


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Budgeting
* Financial Analysis
* Forecasting
* IT
* Project Management
* Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden


 Work experience
   

  

* Product Owner / Product Manager
* General Project Management

title: Group Head of Legal
description:
**About**
 Join to apply for the
 **Group Head of Legal** 
 role at
 **Svea Solar**
 1 day ago Be among the first 25 applicants
   

  

 Join to apply for the
 **Group Head of Legal** 
 role at
 **Svea Solar**
 Svea Solar is revolutionizing energy management, helping customers optimize their use while on a mission to build a fossil-free future. With 50,000+ customers and over a decade of experience, we deliver smart energy solutions for homes and businesses.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Group** 
**Head of Legal** 
 to join us!
   

  

 The role
   

  

 In the role as Group Head of Legal you'll lead and develop the legal function, ensuring effective corporate governance, legal risk management, compliance and strategic legal support across the group. It combines legal expertise with a business-oriented mindset to support and enable key initiatives.
   

  

 You will report to our CHRO and have a team of
 **two lawyers and two student legal assistans** 
 that reports to you.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Being a legal business partner to the organization, supporting and advising the business in commercial negotiations, partnerships, and product innovation
* Develop and drive governance frameworks and forums across the group and support in board and executive matters
* Act as strategic advisor to the CEO and executive team on legal and regulatory risk
* Manage and set the strategy for the legal department and team
* Develop and maintain contract templates (including general terms), legal tools, and policies and drive best practices for contract management across the business
* Deliver legal training and scalable processes to support the business
* Help define and coordinate compliance areas and support the company’s compliance efforts in collaboration with other departments, for example data privacy, consumer protection, sustainability and marketing
* Own and manage corporate structure, shareholder matters and investor-related topics
* Take a core role in strategic, cross-functional projects, such as fundraising
* Manage a network of external expert advisors
* Build for the long term!


 Are we a match?
   

  

 It's essential that you can stand by our values. Our environment offers opportunities to create impact and steer how the function will continue developing. You will thrive here if you enjoy a fast-paced and dynamic environment where excellent organizational and time management skills are essential.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Nordic law degree, with a strong track record from Swedish law
* Around 10 years of legal experience, ideally with a mix of law firm and in-house roles
* Have a strong background in commercial and corporate law, with solid contract drafting and negotiation skills
* Comfortable operating independently and cross-functionally in a dynamic environment
* Strategic thinker with a pragmatic, business-minded approach
* High integrity, sound judgment and decisiveness under pressure
* Ability to move between strategic and high-level perspectives down to detailed hands-on matters
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English


 What we offer
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment.
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

**Application**
 Join us in the power shift towards a sustainable future! You can apply with your LinkedIn profile, and we do not require a traditional CV or cover letter.
   

  

 We will ask several questions during the application process to help us comprehend your profile better.
   

  

 Read more about our standard recruitment process: more about working at Svea Solar:

* Employment type Full-time


**Job function**
* Job function Legal
* Industries Solar Electric Power Generation

title: Patent Attorney
description:
**About**
 Join to apply for the
 **Patent Attorney** 
 role at
 **Scania Group**
 5 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants
   

  

 Join to apply for the
 **Patent Attorney** 
 role at
 **Scania Group**
 Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.
   

  

 Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We offer being part of this important transformation to sustainable transport and being part of Scania Group IP department, a team of highly skilled colleagues who take pride in providing high quality service within their fields and to facilitate this we offer continuous training and personal development both in IP, Scania´s products and areas related to Scania’s ways of working. You will also work closely with our IP colleagues within the TRATON Group.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As a Patent Attorney at Scania, you are responsible for managing the patent portfolio within a specific technical area. Your mission is to ensure that the products and services developed in this field:
   

  

* Have adequate patent protection in relevant markets
* Can be launched without the risk of being blocked by third-party intellectual property rights


 Most of the case prosecution in Sweden and before the European Patent Office (EPO) is handled in-house, while work in other countries is managed through local agents.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Maintain close contact with R&D engineers at Scania and/or Traton to Identify and capture new inventions and Follow up throughout the entire patent application process
* Collaborate with R&D management to make decisions related to patent filings
* Participate in development projects to gain insights into long-term technical strategies
* Serve as an expert resource in IP-related matters for other parts of the company, such as Purchasing and Marketing.
* Represent Scania and Traton in IP matters in collaboration projects with external partners, e.g., within the Volkswagen Group


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Patent Attorney with at least few years’ experience from industry, Private Practice or a Patent Office. It is particularly advantageous if you are competent within the field of vehicle technology, and in particular automotive components. It is also advantageous if you are a European Patent Attorney or have started studying for the EQE.
   

  

 You find it easy to interact with others but are also comfortable processing tasks on your own within your field. You must be open for new ideas and willing to change the way things are done. Since most of our correspondence is in English and Swedish, you must be proficient in this in writing as well as speaking. It is also advantageous if you have at least basic knowledge of German.
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Today we have a great team of 17 Patent attorneys and Paralegals at the Group IP Department and you will be a part of one of the groups of Patent Attorneys. Our office is located at Scania Technical Centre in Södertälje. The commute from Stockholm is easy with our own commuter bus departing from Cityterminalen and Liljeholmen. We also offer a hybrid working model.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-10. This advertisement will remain posted for an extended period due to the ongoing industrial holiday. We will begin the selection process in week 33. Feedback regarding this position will therefore be provided during week 33. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Annika Ahling (Head of Patents and Design Administration) at +46855350351 or ; or Christer Falk (Head of Group IP Department) at +46855383109 or
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
